name: NPR
text:
In his new book, CNN's Brian Stelter says President Trump's "cozy" relationship with Sean Hannity is "like nothing we've seen in American history" — and describes the president as a "shadow producer" for the Fox News host.
https://t.co/32jlfdiZ2x

name: NPR
text:
Speaking at #RNC2020, Navajo Nation Vice President Myron Lizer offered praise for President Trump and Supreme Court Justice Neil Gorsuch.

It comes a week after Jonathan Nez — Navajo Nation president — spoke in a keynote in support of Joe Biden at the DNC. https://t.co/tuPElm4f9A

name: NPR
text:
Joe Biden had a former Republican governor of Ohio and a Republican former secretary of state speak at the DNC.

President Trump has had a Democratic state representative from Georgia, and the Democratic mayor of Eveleth, Minn. — population 3,718.
https://t.co/I77tkR8web

name: NPR
text:
A bevy of speakers—including some prominent nonwhite Republicans—have mounted a defense of Trump’s record on race relations.

But the convention has also featured speakers who've accused protesters fighting for racial justice of being violent extremists. https://t.co/4cfqDYLFTN

name: NPR
text:
The University of Alabama is reporting more than 560 new COVID-19 cases across its 3 campuses and medical center less than a week after starting in-person classes.
https://t.co/icTsh6vhfW

name: NPR
text:
The Ohio State University has temporarily suspended more than 200 students who hosted or attended parties of 10 or more people without practicing physical distancing or wearing face coverings.
https://t.co/9OtkrycKlK

name: NPR
text:
The RNC showed a naturalization ceremony for five new citizens.

The moment aimed to show Trump looking presidential — and is likely to incense critics over his refusal to draw a hard line between official White House business and running for reelection. https://t.co/PZE2ryVYaJ

name: NPR
text:
Ammon Bundy, who led an armed standoff against federal agents in Oregon in 2016, was arrested at the Idaho state capitol for trespassing and refusing to leave following an apparent protest Tuesday.
https://t.co/kLCZfxExDD

name: NPR
text:
Here's a little history on the White House Rose Garden, the backdrop of first lady Melania Trump’s prime-time speech at the RNC.
https://t.co/yg2NpA27IB

name: NPR
text:
The House Foreign Affairs Committee’s panel on oversight informed the State Department that it is launching an investigation into Mike Pompeo’s RNC speech, which sparked concern about possible law violations for public servants.
https://t.co/pFBmAUcdR2

name: NPR
text:
“Mr. Vice President, look at me. I am Black,” Kentucky AG Daniel Cameron said, addressing Joe Biden directly. “We are not all the same, sir. I am not in chains. My mind is my own, and you can’t tell me how to vote because of the color of my skin.”
https://t.co/beZGQJcrRY

name: NPR
text:
A Kentucky man accused of breaking Canada's COVID-19 quarantine order (twice) could be forced to pay a $569,000 fine and spend up to 6 months in prison — or both.
https://t.co/x96bsR0wtI
